item.title: Local Area Network (LAN)
item.description: A local area network covers a small geographic area, like a home, office or a group of buildings

item.title: Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)
item.description: This type of network interconnects computers in a geographic area which is larger than [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/local_area_network_(LAN)|LAN]] but smaller than [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/wide_area_network_(WAN)|WAN]]

item.title: More Types of Networks
item.description: Storage area network (SAN) Campus area network (CAN) Personal area network (PAN) Body area network (BAN)

item.title: Types of Networks
item.description: [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/local_area_network_(LAN)|Local Area Networks (LAN) ]] [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/metropolitan_area_network_(MAN)|Metropolitan Area Network (MAN)]] [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/wide_area_network_(WAN)|Wide Area Network (WAN) ]]

item.title: Wide Area Network (WAN)
item.description: This type of network covers a broad area WANs are used to connect [[nibm_notes/introduction_to_computer_science/computer_networks/local_area_network_(LAN)|LANs]] and other types of networks
